summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's access to discovery materials while detained at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The Government responds to an MDC request to vacate an order granting Maxwell weekend laptop access, stating it generally defers to MDC's inmate management but has no objection to Maxwell's request for additional access.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, who is seeking extended access to a laptop to review discovery materials while detained at the MDC.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom this letter from the Government is addressed.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Court Order for Weekend Laptop Access
events.description: The Court issued an order directing the MDC to permit Ghislaine Maxwell to use a laptop to review discovery on weekends and holidays.

events.title: MDC Counsel Letter Request
events.description: Legal counsel at the Metropolitan Detention Center sent a letter to the Court asking it to vacate its January 15, 2021 order granting Maxwell weekend laptop access.

events.title: First Discovery Production
events.description: The Government made its first discovery production in the case, totaling more than two million pages.

events.title: Laptop Delivery to MDC
events.description: The Government hand-delivered a laptop to the MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell's exclusive use to review discovery materials.

keyFacts: The discovery material in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell totals more than two million pages.
Ghislaine Maxwell was being afforded 13 hours per day, 7 days a week to review discovery while detained at the MDC.
The MDC permitted Maxwell to use a Government-provided laptop for discovery review on weekdays, but only a BOP desktop computer on weekends and holidays.
The Government generally defers to the MDC's judgment in managing inmates but stated it had no objection to Maxwell's request for weekend laptop access.
The trial date was approximately six months away from the date of this letter (February 1, 2021).
